page.title: 02NEWS
page.content: On Thursday, 20th June, 1985, we looked through the local newspapers to choose a few items of local interest. {SCOUTING}and{GIRL GUIDES}are popular in Inverness and last weekend the{CHIEF SCOUT,MAJOR GENERAL MICHAEL {WALSH}visited Inverness. All the local cubs and scouts were at{CAMERON {BARRACKS}to demonstrate their skills. In the{QUEEN'S BIRTHDAY HONOURS {LIST,Mr. Russell Johnston}who has been M.P. for Inverness for 21 years representing the{LIBERALS,}and whose family attended our school, was knighted. The new{GOVERNMENT TRANSPORT BILL} is causing a lot of worry to people in the rural areas of the Highlands. Few of these routes make a profit and some may have to close down.
